I'm running "3: Confirm Back/Forward Functionality" in the "navigating and displaying messages" Litmus test case using Earlybird (10.0a2) while reading messages using the optional message pane. I read two messages in one account, and then read three in another account. I then used "Go -> Back" several times. 

When it went back to a message in the other account it did not select the message (the message was not selected in the folder listing and the contents not displayed in the message pane), though when it went back to the second message in that account it selected the message. Same problem if I used the "[" shortcut. Running in safe mode had no effect (same problem). 

Going forward (Go -> Forward) has the same problem when it changes an account.

I'm running "3: Confirm Back/Forward Functionality" in the "navigating and displaying messages" Litmus test case using Earlybird (10.0a2) while reading messages using the optional message pane. I read two messages in one account, and then read three in another account. I then used "Go -> Back" several times. 

When it went back to a message in the other account it did not select the message (the message was not selected in the folder listing and the contents not displayed in the message pane), though when it went back to the second message in that account it selected the message. Same problem if I used the "[" shortcut. Running in safe mode had no effect (same problem). 

Going forward (Go -> Forward) has the same problem when it changes an account.

I can confirm this on Linux (Ubuntu, 64-bit), even though I'd describe the behaviour as follows: to go back (or forward) between the messages read in different accounts, it is necessary to take one additional step back (or forward). So no message is skipped and the original order is preserved, but it seems as if the switching of accounts is an extra step in the back (or forward) history. This is counter-intuitive, especially since there is no visual feedback given to indicate this extra step.
